item.name: Authentication

request.description:
## ğŸ“ **Description**

This endpoint is used to register a new user into the system with specified credentials and assigned

roles.

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: No
    
- Type: None (Public Access)
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

- Example:
    
- {  
    "firstName": "randomFirstname",  
    "lastName": "randomLastName",  
    "userName": "randomUserName",  
    "passWord": "user123456",  
    "email": "randomuser_1[@gmail.com](https://mailto:aadmin_1@gmail.com)",  
    "phoneNumber": "5555555555",  
    "roles": \[  
    "User"  
    \]  
    }
    
- You can adjust the values â€‹â€‹as you wish.

exec: pm.globals.set("accesToken", accesToken); // GLOBAL DEÄÄ°ÅKEN DE BÃ–YLE

request.description:
## ğŸ“ **Description**

This endpoint authenticates a admin by validating their username and password. Upon successful

authentication, it returns an access token and a refresh token.

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: No
    
- Type: None (Public Access)
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

- Example:
    
- {  
    "userName": "aadmin",  
    "passWord": "aadmin123456"  
    }

exec: pm.globals.set("accesToken", accesToken); // GLOBAL DEÄÄ°ÅKEN DE BÃ–YLE

request.description:
## ğŸ“ **Description**

This endpoint refreshes the JWT access token for a admin using a valid refresh token. It

helps maintain the session without requiring the user to log in again.

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: Yes
    
- Type: Bearer Token
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

- Example:
    
- {  
    "accesToken": "{{accesToken}}",  
    "refreshToken": "{{refreshToken}}"  
    }

## ğŸ“ **Description**

This endpoint is used to register a new user into the system with specified credentials and assigned

roles.

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: No
    
- Type: None (Public Access)
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

- Example:
    
- {  
    "firstName": "randomFirstname",  
    "lastName": "randomLastName",  
    "userName": "randomUserName",  
    "passWord": "user123456",  
    "email": "randomuser_1[@gmail.com](https://mailto:aadmin_1@gmail.com)",  
    "phoneNumber": "5555555555",  
    "roles": \[  
    "User"  
    \]  
    }
    
- You can adjust the values â€‹â€‹as you wish.

exec: pm.globals.set("accesToken", accesToken); // GLOBAL DEÄÄ°ÅKEN DE BÃ–YLE

request.description:
## ğŸ“ **Description**

This endpoint authenticates a manager by validating their username and password. Upon successful

authentication, it returns an access token and a refresh token.

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: No
    
- Type: None (Public Access)
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

- Example:
    
- {  
    "userName": "mmanager",  
    "passWord": "mmanager123456",  
    }

## ğŸ“ **Description**

This endpoint refreshes the JWT access token for a manager using a valid refresh token. It

helps maintain the session without requiring the user to log in again.

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: Yes
    
- Type: Bearer Token
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

- Example:
    
- {  
    "accesToken": "{{accesToken}}",  
    "refreshToken": "{{refreshToken}}"  
    }

## ğŸ“ **Description**

This endpoint is used to register a new user into the system with specified credentials and assigned

roles.

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: No
    
- Type: None (Public Access)
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

- Example:
    
- {  
    "firstName": "randomFirstname",  
    "lastName": "randomLastName",  
    "userName": "randomUserName",  
    "passWord": "user123456",  
    "email": "randomuser_1[@gmail.com](https://mailto:aadmin_1@gmail.com)",  
    "phoneNumber": "5555555555",  
    "roles": \[  
    "User"  
    \]  
    }
    
- You can adjust the values â€‹â€‹as you wish.

exec: pm.globals.set("accesToken", accesToken); // GLOBAL DEÄÄ°ÅKEN DE BÃ–YLE

request.description:
## ğŸ“ **Description**

This endpoint authenticates a user by validating their username and password. Upon successful

authentication, it returns an access token and a refresh token.

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: No
    
- Type: None (Public Access)
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

- Example:
    
- {  
    "userName": "uuser",  
    "passWord": "uuser123456"  
    }

## ğŸ“ **Description**

This endpoint refreshes the JWT access token for a user using a valid refresh token. It

helps maintain the session without requiring the user to log in again.

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: Yes
    
- Type: Bearer Token
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

- Example:
    
- {  
    "accesToken": "{{accesToken}}",  
    "refreshToken": "{{refreshToken}}"  
    }

## ğŸ“ **Description**

This endpoint logs out the authenticated user by invalidating the current refresh token. It ensures

that the token cannot be reused to obtain new access tokens.

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: Yes
    
- Type: Bearer Token
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

- None

item.description:
## ğŸ—‚ï¸ **Authentication Folder Description**

This folder contains all endpoints related to user identity management and authentication operations. It supports different user roles such as `Admin`, `Manager`, and `User`.

## ğŸ” Key Features

- **Registration**
    
    Register a new user with specific roles (Admin, Manager, User).
    
- **Authentication**
    
    Authenticate users and obtain access & refresh tokens using their credentials.
    
- **Token Refreshing**
    
    Securely refresh access tokens using the previously issued refresh token.
    
- **Logout**
    
    Invalidate the current refresh token to log out the user.
    

## ğŸ‘¥ Roles Covered

- Admin
    
- Manager
    
- User
    

### ğŸ›¡ï¸ Authorization

Most endpoints require a valid **Bearer Token**, except for the registration request.

item.name: Departments

request.description:
## ğŸ“ Description

This endpoint retrieves a list of all existing Departments from the database

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: Yes
    
- Type: Bearer Token
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

- None

## ğŸ“ Description

This endpoint retrieves a list of all existing Departments from the database.

If the client requests a response format that the server does not support (e.g., an unsupported `Accept` header value), the server will return a **406 Not Acceptable** status code.

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: Yes
    
- Type: Bearer Token
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

- None

## ğŸ“ Description

This endpoint retrieves a list of all existing Departments from the database in **CSV format**.

To receive the response in CSV, make sure to set the `Accept` header to `text/csv`.

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: Yes
    
- Type: Bearer Token
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

- None

## ğŸ“ Description

This endpoint retrieves a list of all existing Departments from the database in XML **format**.

To receive the response in XML, make sure to set the `Accept` header to `application/xml`.

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: Yes
    
- Type: Bearer Token
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

- None

## ğŸ“ **Description**

This endpoint retrieves the details of a specific Department from the database using its unique ID.

The ID must be provided as a path parameter in the URL.

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: Yes
    
- Type: Bearer Token
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

- None

## ğŸ“ **Description**

This endpoint attempts to retrieve a Department by a non-existing or invalid ID.

It is used to test how the system handles requests for departments that do not exist in the database.

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: Yes
    
- Type: Bearer Token
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

- None

## ğŸ“ **Description**

This endpoint retrieves a single Department by its ID and returns the response formatted in XML.

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: Yes
    
- Type: Bearer Token
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

- None

## ğŸ“ **Description**

This endpoint retrieves a single Department by its ID and returns the response formatted in CSV.

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: Yes
    
- Type: Bearer Token
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

- None

## ğŸ“ **Description**

This endpoint retrieves a paginated list of Departments from the database based on the specified

`page number` and `page size` query parameters.

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: Yes
    
- Type: Bearer Token
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

- None

## ğŸ“ **Description**

This endpoint retrieves a list of Departments from the database ordered according to the specified

`OrderBy` query parameter.

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: Yes
    
- Type: Bearer Token
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

- None

## ğŸ“ **Description**

This endpoint retrieves Departments from the database whose names contain the specified search

term provided in the `DepartmentName` query parameter.

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: Yes
    
- Type: Bearer Token
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

- None

## ğŸ“ **Description**

This endpoint retrieves all Departments from the database, returning only the specified fields

defined in the `Fields` query parameter (data shaping).

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: Yes
    
- Type: Bearer Token
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

- None

## ğŸ“ **Description**

This endpoint retrieves a filtered, paginated, and sorted list of Departments from the database based on the given query parameters. It also returns only the specified fields using data shaping.

- ğŸ” **Filter**: `DepartmentName=Ä°`
    
- ğŸ“„ **Pagination**: `PageNumber=1`, `PageSize=3`
    
- ğŸ§® **Sorting**: `OrderBy=DepartmentName`
    
- ğŸ§© **Data Shaping**: `Fields=DepartmentName`
    

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: Yes
    
- Type: Bearer Token
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

- None

## ğŸ“ **Description**

This endpoint creates a new department in the database using the provided `departmentID` and

`departmentName`. The department ID must be unique.

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: Yes
    
- Type: Bearer Token
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

{  
"departmentID": {{randomDepartmentId}},  
"departmentName": "{{randomDepartmentName}}"  
}

- You can adjust the values â€‹â€‹as you wish.

## ğŸ“ **Description**

This endpoint attempts to create a new department but triggers a `415 Unsupported Media Type`

error due to incorrect or missing `Content-Type` header. The server expects the request body to be

in JSON format.

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: Yes
    
- Type: Bearer Token
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

Any payload â€” but the `Content-Type` header is missing or incorrect.

## ğŸ“ **Description**

This endpoint attempts to create a new department, but it fails with a `409 Conflict` response

because a department with the same `departmentID` and `departmentName` already exists in the

database.

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: Yes
    
- Type: Bearer Token
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

- {  
    "departmentID": 3,  
    "departmentName": "YazÄ±lÄ±m"  
    }

## ğŸ“ **Description**

This endpoint attempts to create a new department but returns a `422 Unprocessable Entity` error

because the request body is syntactically correct but semantically invalid â€” for example, required

fields may be missing or contain invalid values.

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: Yes
    
- Type: Bearer Token
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

{

}

## ğŸ“ **Description**

This endpoint attempts to create a new department but returns a `400 Bad Request` error due to a

malformed request body â€” for example, empty request body, missing JSON fields, incorrect

property names, or an invalid data format.

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: Yes
    
- Type: Bearer Token
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

- None

## ğŸ“ **Description**

This endpoint updates an existing department in the database using the specified `departmentID` in

the URL. The request body must include the new values for the department.

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: Yes
    
- Type: Bearer Token
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

{  
"departmentName": "Postmannn"  
}

- Always make sure that the department is still valid before update operation.

## ğŸ“ **Description**

This endpoint attempts to update an existing department but fails due to an unsupported or missing

`Content-Type` header. The server expects the request body to be sent in a supported media type,

such as `application/json`.

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: Yes
    
- Type: Bearer Token
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

Body is present but sent with an incorrect or missing `Content-Type` header.

## ğŸ“ **Description**

This endpoint attempts to update a department using a non-existent `DepartmentID`. The server

returns a 404 error indicating that the specified resource could not be found in the database.

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: Yes
    
- Type: Bearer Token
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

{  
"departmentName": "Postmannn"  
}

## ğŸ“ **Description**

This endpoint attempts to update an existing department but fails due to an invalid request body or

missing required fields. The server returns a `400 Bad Request` response indicating the client sent

data the server could not process.

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: Yes
    
- Type: Bearer Token
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

- None

## ğŸ“ **Description**

This endpoint attempts to update a department but fails due to semantic errors in the request body.

Although the request format is correct, the content violates business rules (e.g., department name

is too short or invalid). The server returns a `422 Unprocessable Entity` response.

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: Yes
    
- Type: Bearer Token
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

- {
    

}

## ğŸ“ **Description**

This endpoint deletes an existing department from the database by its unique Department ID.

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: Yes
    
- Type: Bearer Token
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

- None
    

## ğŸ“Œ **Note**

- Make sure the provided `DepartmentID` exists before calling this endpoint.
    
- Deletion is permanent and cannot be undone.

## ğŸ“ **Description**

This endpoint attempts to delete a department using an invalid or non-existing Department ID and

returns a `404 Not Found` error.

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: Yes
    
- Type: Bearer Token
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

- None

## ğŸ“ **Description**

This endpoint returns the supported HTTP methods (OPTIONS) for the Departments resource,

helping clients understand which operations are allowed.

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: Yes
    
- Type: Bearer Token
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

- None

## ğŸ“ **Description**

This endpoint returns only the headers without the response body for the Departments resource.

It is mainly used to check metadata such as status codes, content type, and available headers.

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: Yes
    
- Type: Bearer Token
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

- None

item.description:
## ğŸ“ Description

#### This folder contains API endpoints related to department management. You can retrieve, create, update, or delete department records. It supports features like filtering, pagination, sorting, and data shaping to efficiently query department data.

## ğŸ“ **Description**

- ğŸ” **Filter**: `MinSalary=35000, MaxSalary=45000`
    
- ğŸ” **OrderBy**: `FirtName asc`
    
- ğŸ“„ **Pagination**: `PageNumber=1`, `PageSize=3`

- ğŸ§© **Data Shaping**: `Fields=FirstName,LastName`
    

## ğŸ” Authorization

request.description:
## ğŸ“ **Description**

This endpoint creates a new employee in the database using the provided fields.

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: Yes
    
- Type: Bearer Token
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

{  
"employeeID": 1110,  
"firstName": "randomFirstName",  
"lastName": "randomLastName",  
"salary": 37000,  
"departmentID": 1,  
"jobID": 1  
}

- You can adjust the values â€‹â€‹as you wish.

## ğŸ“ **Description**

This endpoint attempts to create a new employee but triggers a `415 Unsupported Media Type`

error due to incorrect or missing `Content-Type` header. The server expects the request body to be

in JSON format.

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: Yes
    
- Type: Bearer Token
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

Any payload â€” but the `Content-Type` header is missing or incorrect.

## ğŸ“ **Description**

This endpoint attempts to create a new employee, but it fails with a `409 Conflict` response

because a employee with the same `employeeID` already exists in the database.

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: Yes
    
- Type: Bearer Token
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

{  
"employeeID": 1,  
"firstName": "string",  
"lastName": "string",  
"salary": 0,  
"departmentID": 1,  
"jobID": 1  
}

## ğŸ“ **Description**

This endpoint attempts to create a new employee but returns a `422 Unprocessable Entity` error

because the request body is syntactically correct but semantically invalid â€” for example, required

fields may be missing or contain invalid values.

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: Yes
    
- Type: Bearer Token
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

{

"employeeID": 0,

"firstName": "string",

"lastName": "string"

}

## ğŸ“ **Description**

This endpoint attempts to create a new employee but returns a `400 Bad Request` error due to a

malformed request body â€” for example, empty request body, missing JSON fields, incorrect

property names, or an invalid data format.

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: Yes
    
- Type: Bearer Token
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

- None

## ğŸ“ **Description**

This endpoint updates an existing employee in the database using the specified `employeeID` in

the URL. The request body must include the new values for the employee.

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: Yes
    
- Type: Bearer Token
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

{  
"firstName": "RandomEmp",  
"lastName": "RandomLastname",  
"salary": 4000,  
"departmentID": 1,  
"jobID": 1  
}

- Always make sure that the employee is still valid before update operation.

## ğŸ“ **Description**

This endpoint attempts to update an existing employee but fails due to an unsupported or missing

`Content-Type` header. The server expects the request body to be sent in a supported media type,

such as `application/json`.

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: Yes
    
- Type: Bearer Token
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

Body is present but sent with an incorrect or missing `Content-Type` header.

## ğŸ“ **Description**

This endpoint attempts to update a employee using a non-existent `employeeID`. The server

returns a 404 error indicating that the specified resource could not be found in the database.

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: Yes
    
- Type: Bearer Token
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

{  
"firstName": "string",  
"lastName": "string",  
"salary": 0,  
"departmentID": 0,  
"jobID": 0  
}

## ğŸ“ **Description**

This endpoint attempts to update an existing employee but fails due to an invalid request body or

missing required fields. The server returns a `400 Bad Request` response indicating the client sent

data the server could not process.

}

request.description:
## ğŸ“ Description

This endpoint retrieves a list of all existing Jobs from the database

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: Yes
    
- Type: Bearer Token
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

- None

## ğŸ“ Description

This endpoint retrieves a list of all existing Jobs from the database.

If the client requests a response format that the server does not support (e.g., an unsupported `Accept` header value), the server will return a **406 Not Acceptable** status code.

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: Yes
    
- Type: Bearer Token
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

- None

## ğŸ“ Description

This endpoint retrieves a list of all existing Jobs from the database in **CSV format**.

To receive the response in CSV, make sure to set the `Accept` header to `text/csv`.

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: Yes
    
- Type: Bearer Token
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

- None

## ğŸ“ Description

This endpoint retrieves a list of all existing Jobs from the database in XML **format**.

To receive the response in XML, make sure to set the `Accept` header to `application/xml`.

- Required: Yes
    
- Type: Bearer Token
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

- None

## ğŸ“ Description

This endpoint retrieves the details of a specific Job from the database using its unique ID.

The ID must be provided as a path parameter in the URL.

- Required: Yes
    
- Type: Bearer Token
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

- None

## ğŸ“ **Description**

This endpoint attempts to retrieve a Job by a non-existing or invalid ID.

It is used to test how the system handles requests for Jobs that do not exist in the database.

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: Yes
    
- Type: Bearer Token

- None

## ğŸ“ **Description**

This endpoint retrieves a single Job by its ID and returns the response formatted in XML.

- Required: Yes
    
- Type: Bearer Token
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

- None

## ğŸ“ **Description**

This endpoint retrieves a single Job by its ID and returns the response formatted in CSV.

- Required: Yes
    
- Type: Bearer Token

- None

## ğŸ“ **Description**

This endpoint retrieves a paginated list of Jobs from the database based on the specified

`page number` and `page size` query parameters.

## ğŸ“ **Description**

This endpoint retrieves a list of jobs based on multiple query parameters including department ID,

partial job title, sorting preferences, and selected fields.

- ğŸ§¾ **Filtering**: `DepartmentID`, `JobTitle`
    
- ğŸ“„ **Pagination**: `PageNumber`, `PageSize`
    
- ğŸ”ƒ **Ordering**: `OrderBy` (e.g., `JobTitle asc`, `JobID asc`)
    
- ğŸ§© **Data Shaping**: `Fields` (e.g., `JobTitle`, `JobId`)
    

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: Yes
    
- Type: Bearer Token
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

- None

request.description:
## ğŸ“ **Description**

This endpoint creates a new job in the database using the provided fields.

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: Yes
    
- Type: Bearer Token
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

{  
"jobID": 0,  
"jobTitle": "string",  
"departmentID": 0  
}

- You can adjust the values â€‹â€‹as you wish.

## ğŸ“ **Description**

This endpoint attempts to create a new job but triggers a `415 Unsupported Media Type`

error due to incorrect or missing `Content-Type` header. The server expects the request body to be

in JSON format.

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: Yes
    
- Type: Bearer Token
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

Any payload â€” but the `Content-Type` header is missing or incorrect.

## ğŸ“ **Description**

This endpoint attempts to create a new job, but it fails with a `409 Conflict` response

because a employee with the same `jobTitle` already exists in the database.

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: Yes
    
- Type: Bearer Token
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

{  
"jobID": 1,  
"jobTitle": "YazÄ±lÄ±m MÃ¼hendisi",  
"departmentID": 1  
}

## ğŸ“ **Description**

This endpoint attempts to create a new job but returns a `422 Unprocessable Entity` error

because the request body is syntactically correct but semantically invalid â€” for example, required

fields may be missing or contain invalid values.

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: Yes
    
- Type: Bearer Token
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

{  
"jobID": 0  
}

## ğŸ“ **Description**

This endpoint attempts to create a new job but returns a `400 Bad Request` error due to a

malformed request body â€” for example, empty request body, missing JSON fields, incorrect

property names, or an invalid data format.

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: Yes
    
- Type: Bearer Token
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

- None

## ğŸ“ **Description**

This endpoint updates an existing job in the database using the specified `jobID` in

the URL. The request body must include the new values for the employee.

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: Yes
    
- Type: Bearer Token
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

{  
"jobTitle": "YazÄ±lÄ±m MÃ¼hendisi.",  
"departmentID": 3  
}

- Always make sure that the job is still valid before update operation.

## ğŸ“ **Description**

This endpoint attempts to update an existing job but fails due to an unsupported or missing

`Content-Type` header. The server expects the request body to be sent in a supported media type,

such as `application/json`.

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: Yes
    
- Type: Bearer Token
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

Body is present but sent with an incorrect or missing `Content-Type` header.

## ğŸ“ **Description**

This endpoint attempts to update a job using a non-existent `jobID`. The server

returns a 404 error indicating that the specified resource could not be found in the database.

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: Yes
    
- Type: Bearer Token
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

{  
"jobTitle": "string",  
"departmentID": 0  
}

## ğŸ“ **Description**

This endpoint attempts to update an existing job but fails due to an invalid request body or

missing required fields. The server returns a `400 Bad Request` response indicating the client sent

data the server could not process.

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: Yes
    
- Type: Bearer Token
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

- None

## ğŸ“ **Description**

This endpoint attempts to update a job but fails due to semantic errors in the request body.

Although the request format is correct, the content violates business rules (e.g., department name

is too short or invalid). The server returns a `422 Unprocessable Entity` response.

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: Yes
    
- Type: Bearer Token
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

- {
    

}

## ğŸ“ **Description**

This endpoint deletes an existing Job from the database by its unique Job ID.

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: Yes
    
- Type: Bearer Token
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

- None
    

## ğŸ“Œ **Note**

- Make sure the provided `JobID` exists before calling this endpoint.
    
- Deletion is permanent and cannot be undone.

## ğŸ“ **Description**

This endpoint attempts to delete a job using an invalid or non-existing Job ID and

returns a `404 Not Found` error.

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: Yes
    
- Type: Bearer Token
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

- None

## ğŸ“ **Description**

This endpoint returns the supported HTTP methods (OPTIONS) for the Jobs resource,

helping clients understand which operations are allowed.

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: Yes
    
- Type: Bearer Token
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

- None

## ğŸ“ **Description**

This endpoint returns only the headers without the response body for the Jobs resource.

It is mainly used to check metadata such as status codes, content type, and available headers.

## ğŸ” Authorization

- Required: Yes
    
- Type: Bearer Token
    

## ğŸ“¥ Request Body

- None

item.description:
## ğŸ“ Description

#### This folder contains API endpoints related to job management. You can retrieve, create, update, or delete department records. It supports features like filtering, pagination, sorting, and data shaping to efficiently query department data.
